notes:
Dear Hon. David Ntiwa.
Sir,
My name is Camille White, i have an inheritance fund with the Union Togolaise De Banque which was been deposited by my late uncle. i am his next of kin.
The fund has been approve by the bank, now the bank is asking me to come down in person to present some documents like an affidavit of claim, the fund exchange of ownership certificate and also to sign some of the fund release/transfer papers.
But due to my tight schedule i can not be able to come down in person. so i was given the option of contacting you as one of the bank accredited lawyer to represent me in doing all the needed things and as-well to sign the fund release documents. 
I want you to act on my behalf.
Kind Regards
Camille white

messages.body:
26 December 2011


I am Barrister Folly Zongo, a solicitor at law, personal attorney to Engr. H. G.  , a national Of your country, who used to work as a contractor with Shell Development Company in Lome Togo, Here in after shall be referred to as my client. On the 21st of April 2002, my client, his wife and their only daughter were involved in a car accident along Sokode express Road. All occupants of the vehicle unfortunately lost their lives. Since then i have made several inquiries to your embassy here to locate any of my clients extended relatives, this has also proved unsuccessful.


After these several unsuccessful attempts, I got your contact from chambers of commerce search while I was searching for any member of his family hence I contacted you. I have contacted you to assist in repatriating the fund valued at US$ 5.5 million left behind by my client before it gets confiscated or declared unserviceable by the African Development Bank where this huge amount was deposited. The said African Development Bank has for sometime now issued me a notice to provide the next of kin of my client or his account shall be declared dormant or possibly confiscated.


Since I have been unsuccessful in locating the relatives for over 7 years now, I seek the consent to present you as the next of kin to the deceased since you have the same last names, so that the proceeds of this account can be paid to you. Therefore, on receipt of your positive response, we shall then discuss the sharing ratio and modalities for transfer. I have all necessary information and legal documents needed to back you up for claim.


All I require from you is your honest cooperation to enable us see this transaction through. My connected email address:- (follyzongo3@yahoo.in) I guarantee that this will be executed under legitimate arrangement that will protect you from any breach of the law.


Best Regards.
BARRISTER Folly Zongo.

messages.body:
27 December 2011


Dear Camille White, 
Thanks for your prompt response to my mail, over the years i have been trying to locate the relatives to my late client but all effort prove abortive. Following the presure on me from the bank were the fund is deposited to provide the next of kin/beneficiary to my late client before the mandate or the deposited fund transfered to the bank traesury account as an abandon fund . I do not want this to happen . 


Hence i have contact you since you share the same last name to my late client , i want to present you to the bank as the beneficiary so that the money can be transfer to your nominated bank account before my arrival to your country for sharing . All i require from you is utmost trust and sincerity to enable us see through this transaction . 


As soon as the money hit your nominated account in your country , i shall be coming over for the sharing . All original documents relating to this transaction are intact with me , i shall forward them to you as we proceed . To enable us proceed you are required to send to me the following informations , this will enable me open a file for you in my office and present you to the bank as the beneficiary . Below are the required informations . 


- YOUR FULL NAME AND ADDRESS . 
- OCCUPATION AND POSITION . 
- DATE OF BIRTH . 
- PRIVATE TELEPHONE AND FAX NUMBER ( to enhance easy communication between us ). 


Upon the receipt of the above informations i will be able to proceed . For more informations on this transactions so that i can be able to explain to your understanding , please call me on my 24 hours service telephone number +228 98 15 62 02 as soon as you receive this mail . 


During our telephone conversation we shall negotiate on our ratio of sharing , once again i want to thank you for all your anticipation in this transaction . 


Thanks as we hope for the best . 
Barrister Folly Zongo.

messages.body:
Mr Zongo,
I'd like to know a little bit more about this guy, like what kind of job he did, and how he made his money, was he the devotee of art, did he have the soul of a bishop or something else, you know what I mean, right?
You can't be too careful when dealing with large amounts of money.


Camille White

(The bits in italics are the titles of H.G. Wells' novels and other writings, all gleaned from Wikipedia.
My aim is to have at least two, and preferably three, in each reply)

messages.body:
Mr Zongo,
I've been busy - my apologies, but some things couldn't be put off. My boyfriend insisted on going to the plant nursery yesterday and we witnessed the flowering of the Strange Orchid - quite a sight; so of course we had to get one for the garden! 
I have to tell you that Mr White's being a man of God doesn't mean squat. Hel, he could have worshipped the Lord of the Dynamos for all I care. Men like gods; I have my own faith - I give my worship to the Aesir. 
- YOUR FULL NAME AND ADDRESS
Camille Michelle White; 35 Westmoreland Grove, Glebe, Sydney, NSW, Australia
- OCCUPATION AND POSITION
Photomodel; I don't get the bit about POSITION though.
- DATE OF BIRTH
12 August 1985 
- PRIVATE TELEPHONE AND FAX NUMBER 
(xx) xxxx xxxx; no fax
Just so you know - if you call, my boyfriend will answer, as I'm hearing impaired.
Camille White

31 December 2011


Dear White,


I recieve your mail, and all the requried informations needed.It is to notify you that i have open a file for you in my chamber as the next/beneficiary to my late client Mr.H.G.White,and a copy of your file was personally submitted to the bank  by my humble self this afternoon.So  the bank is fully awaer of your coming for the clam of the fund wih them.


I collected from the bank an already drafted application form of  claim which i have attach alongside this letter, i want you to print out  the application form, fill the application with the bank required information, sign it and  then  send it back to the bank with  tne bank contact info as stated on the application form.


I want you to have it at the back of your mind  that this transaction should be carried out with absolute trust, no betrayal of any kind.  Meanwhile i want you to be  aware that sharing of this fund is base on ratio as follows; 50 for the peersonal attorney and his chamber members, 40 for you as the next of  kin/beneficiary, 5 for email and telephone calls, while 5 be set aside for orphanage homes, war victims, fire disasters etc in memory of my late client.Be rest assure also that all the necessary documents for the claim of the money is intact with me.


NOT, The application form could not attach , my computer has virus so tomorrow monring first thing i will send the form to you..


Thanks
Folly.

messages.body:
Mr Zongo,
You got a virus, so you said - honestly, some people! 
You lot can be babes in the darkling woodwhen it comes to technology (I'm quoting AJ) - even our little neighbour Ann Veronica is more clued in than you. Hey, I'm blonde and I know better; what's your excuse? 
But seriously - the number I gave you is correct; the nation prefix is +61. Just remember that I won't be answering the phone, as I said.
Camille White

At last... the bank! I can't explain the sudden surge of cap lock, though... A really ghastly document was attached.

Dear Reader, this bit above is the scam. The victim generally can't or won't travel to collect the (imaginary) money, and so pays a (fake) attorney to do it. If the victim actually comes to collect, it's more work for the scammers - staging a fake office, showing the victim fake money.

My Dear sister Camille White,
How are you doing today my dear sister, thanks for your mail, below is the details as i had earlier sent to you.
Thanks for your prompt response to my mail , over the years i have been trying to locate the relatives to my late client but all effort prove abortive . Following the pressure on me from the bank were the fund is deposited to provide the next of kin/beneficiary to my late client before the mandate or the deposited fund will be transferred to the bank Treasury account as an abandon fund. I do not want this to happen.
Hence i have contact you since you share the same last name to my late client, i want to present you to the bank as the beneficiary so that the money can be transfer to your nominated bank account before my arrival to your country for sharing. All i require from you is utmost trust and sincerity to enable us see through this transaction.
As soon as the money hit your nominated account in your country, i shall be coming over for the sharing. All original documents relating to this transaction are intact with me, i shall forward them to you as we proceed. To enable us proceed you are required to send to me the following information's , this will enable me open a file for you in my office and present you to the bank as the beneficiary. Below are the required information's.
- YOUR FULL NAME AND ADDRESS .
- OCCUPATION AND POSITION .
- DATE OF BIRTH .
- PRIVATE TELEPHONE AND FAX NUMBER ( to enhance easy communication between us ).


Upon the receipt of the above information's i will be able to proceed . For more information's on this transactions so that i can be able to explain to your understanding , please call me on my 24 hours service telephone number +228 98 15 62 02 as soon as you receive this mail.
During our telephone conversation we shall negotiate on our ratio of sharing , once again i want to thank you for all your anticipation in this transaction .
Thanks as we hope for the best .
Barrister Folly Zongo.

messages.body:
5 March 2012


MEMBERS
BARRISTER DAVID NTIWA.(ESQ) (PRINCIPAL PARTNER) 
MR. MOHAMED TRAORE LL.B. (S/ PARTNER) 
MR. CONQUEROR HILLARY EKENEDO (TREASURER) 
MRS CYNTHIA GREGORY (SECRETARY) 
Email: david.ntiwa@lawyer.com 


Attention: Mrs. Camille White, 
With the name of our most respected Almighty God, we welcome you to Lawyers Counsel legal chambers & Associates Law Firm, In Respect to your request that you cannot come down to Lome-Togo and of demanding for our legal service to procure the necessary documents to back your claims up in Union Togolaise De Banque Lome-Togo, This Honorable chambers have today received a copy of the bank Acknowledgment letter on our investigation in the bank some hours ago. 


First of all be advised to fill the bank form and send to the bank or through us, We have made every arrangement and investigations concerning your claim, We wish to inform you that we have heard about your case from the bank and we are fully ready to assist you till your claim reaches your hand, That is if you are ready to help yourself too concerning our legal terms and conditions, We don't represent people in a claim like this without receiving our consultation charges.
